h1.aria-label: Update: 2 p.m. April 17, 2020 - Spring ISD’s COVID-19 Update #7
h1.span: Update: 2 p.m. April 17, 2020 - Spring ISD’s COVID-19 Update #7

p.span: Spring ISD Families and Staff:

Keeping in line with the COVID-19 Texas plans issued today, Friday, April 17, by Texas Gov. Abbott, Spring ISD schools will remain closed and offer remote learning through the end of the 2019-20 school year.
The governor had previously ordered schools closed until May 4, but during today’s press conference, Abbott said health officials had
recommended that Texas schools not reopen this school year.

Although we miss instructing and supporting our students in person, we’re grateful for the state’s leadership in making health and safety a priority for our entire community. We will continue to support our students with their instruction so they can finish out the school year successfully through our Empowered Learning At-Home 2.0 initiative.

Over the past several weeks, the district has been loaning Chromebooks to secondary students who need technology and will be loaning Chromebooks to 4th and 5th graders and all Special Education students this Saturday. All students will be completing three Project-Based Learning plans, designed for their specific grade level, to fulfill all of their requirements by the end of the school year.
The district is also making plans to host virtual graduation ceremonies for its
on June 6, with the goal of offering in-person ceremonies, if public health conditions permit, at the district’s Planet Ford Stadium at the end of July.

We are very proud of all of our students who continue to stay focused on learning during these challenging times. We’re also grateful to parents and guardians for stepping up and helping us help your students continue to learn and thrive during difficult circumstances.
More information about the district’s response to COVID-19 can be found on the district’s website at
. For more information about the district’s remote learning plans, please visit the
website.
Thank you to everyone for your support,
Spring ISD
Familias y personal de Spring ISD:

Manteniéndose en línea con los planes de COVID-19 de Texas emitidos hoy, viernes 17 de abril, por el gobernador Abbott, las escuelas de Spring ISD permanecerán cerradas y ofrecerán aprendizaje a distancia hasta el final del año escolar 2019-20.

El gobernador había ordenado previamente el cierre de las escuelas hasta el 4 de mayo, pero durante la conferencia de prensa de hoy, Abbott dijo que los funcionarios de salud recomendaron que las escuelas de Texas no se reabran este año escolar.

Aunque extrañamos instruir y apoyar a nuestros estudiantes en persona, estamos agradecidos por el liderazgo del estado en hacer de la salud y la seguridad una prioridad para toda nuestra comunidad. Continuaremos apoyando a nuestros estudiantes con su instrucción para que puedan terminar el año escolar con éxito a través de nuestra iniciativa, Aprendiza empoderado en casa 2.0.

Durante las últimas semanas, el distrito ha prestado Chromebooks a estudiantes de secundaria que necesitan tecnología y prestará Chromebooks a estudiantes de 4to y 5to grado y a todos los estudiantes de Educación Especial este sábado. Todos los estudiantes completarán tres planes de aprendizaje basados ​​en proyectos, diseñados para su nivel de grado específico, para cumplir con todos sus requisitos al final del año escolar.
El distrito también está haciendo planes para organizar ceremonias de graduación virtuales para su
el 6 de junio, con el objetivo de ofrecer ceremonias en persona, si las condiciones de salud pública lo permiten, en el Estadio Planet Ford del distrito a fines de julio.

Estamos muy orgullosos de todos nuestros estudiantes que continúan enfocados en aprender durante estos tiempos difíciles. También estamos agradecidos con los padres y tutores por apoyarnos y ayudarnos a que sus estudiantes continúen aprendiendo y prosperando en circunstancias difíciles.
Puede encontrar más información sobre la respuesta del distrito a COVID-19 en el sitio web del distrito en
. Para obtener más información sobre los planes de aprendizaje remoto del distrito, visite el sitio web de
Gracias a todos por su apoyo,
Spring ISD

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.p: Spring ISD is closely monitoring the evolving situation with COVID-19. The district is working closely with local, state and federal officials to protect the health and safety of our staff, students and families.

Our district’s standard health procedure is to ask that ill students and staff stay home. This is especially important with any person who is running a fever, has a cough and/or difficulty breathing. In those cases, we ask that you contact your health provider immediately. Should anyone with these symptoms come to school, we will ask that they return home immediately.

The symptoms of influenza and COVID-19 are very similar (fever, body aches, coughing and generally feeling bad). If you are experiencing any of the above symptoms, you should seek medical attention. The doctor can do a simple test to get the proper diagnosis and treatment.
Spring ISD will keep you updated as more information becomes available.
